sen.j: 高国造（たかのくにみやつこ・たかこくぞう)は常陸国北部を支配した国造。
sen.e: Takanokunimiyatsuko 高国造 was kuninomiyatsuko ruled the north part of Hitachi Province.
Taka no kunimiyatsuko 高国造 was kuninomiyatsuko (local ruling families in ancient Japan) ruled the north part of Hitachi Province.
sen.cmt: local ruling families in ancient Japan を追加しました。
sen.e: Taka no kunimiyatsuko 高国造 was kuninomiyatsuko (local ruling families in ancient Japan) ruled the north part of Hitachi Province.
It was also written as 多珂国造.
It was also written as 多珂国造.
It was also written as 多珂国造.
Takehiyodorinomikoto.
Takehiyodori no mikoto.
Takehiyodori no mikoto.

sen.j: 別名は武夷鳥命・天夷鳥命・天日照命など。
sen.e: Pseudonyms were Takehiyodorinomikoto, Amenohinadorinomikoto, Amenohinaderinomikoto, and the like.
Pseudonyms were Takehiyodori no mikoto, Amenohinadori no mikoto, Amenohinaderi no mikoto, and the like.
Pseudonyms were Takehiyodori no mikoto, Amenohinadori no mikoto, Amenohinaderi no mikoto, and the like.
He was a son of Amenohohinokami.
He was a son of Amenohohi no kami.
He was a son of Amenohohi no kami.

sen.j: 『常陸風土記』によると成務天皇朝にその子孫の建御狭日命(『国造本紀』では彌佐比命)が高国造に任じられたという。
sen.e: According to "Hitachi Fudoki", Tatemisahinomikoto, a descendant from Takehiyodorinomikoto (Misahinomikoto according to "Kuninomiyatsuko hongi") was appointed Takanokunimiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Seimu.

According to "Hitachi Fudoki," Tatemisahi no mikoto, a descendant from Takehiyodori no mikoto (Misahi no mikoto according to "Kuni no miyatsuko hongi") was appointed Taka no kunimiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Seimu.
sen.cmt: カンマの位置を調整表記変更
sen.e: According to "Hitachi Fudoki," Tatemisahi no mikoto, a descendant from Takehiyodori no mikoto (Misahi no mikoto according to "Kuni no miyatsuko hongi") was appointed Taka no kunimiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Seimu.

sen.j: 岩城氏(磐城氏)......出雲氏の後裔。
sen.e: The Iwaki clan: Descendants from the Izumo clan.
The Iwaki clan: Descendants from the Izumo clan.
The Iwaki clan: Descendants from the Izumo clan.
Kabane was Atai.
Kabane was Atai.
Kabane was Atai.
Taka Gun, Hitachi Province.
Taka Gun, Hitachi Province.
Taka Gun, Hitachi Province.

sen.j: 現在の茨城県高萩市・北茨城市など。
sen.e: Present Takahagi City, Kitaibaraki City, and the like, Ibaraki Prefecture.
Present Takahagi City, Kitaibaraki City, and the like, Ibaraki Prefecture.
Present Takahagi City, Kitaibaraki City, and the like, Ibaraki Prefecture.

sen.j: 佐波波地祗神社(茨城県北茨城市)か。
sen.e: It was probably Sawawachigi-jinja Shrine (Ibaraki City, Ibaraki Prefecture.)
It was probably Sawawachigi-jinja Shrine (Ibaraki City, Ibaraki Prefecture.)
It was probably Sawawachigi-jinja Shrine (Ibaraki City, Ibaraki Prefecture.)

sen.j: 岩城美夜都......古墳時代の豪族。
sen.e: IWAKI no Miyatsu: A regional powerful clan during the Kofun period.
IWAKI no Miyatsu: A regional powerful clan during the Kofun period.
IWAKI no Miyatsu: A regional powerful clan during the Kofun period.

sen.j: 多珂国を多珂郡と岩城郡とに分割申請した。
sen.e: He applied to divide Takanokuni into Taka Gun and Iwaki Gun.
He applied to divide Takanokuni into Taka Gun and Iwaki Gun.
